name: likert_elicitation_title_plot
system_prompt:
You are an assistant tasked with predicting the user's perception of serendipity in 6 lists of movies.  
For each movie, you are given its: title, plot.
Additionally, you are provided with a separate list of preferred movies that represent the user's taste.  

Your task is to analyze the movies in each of the 6 lists and compare them to each other as well as to the preferred movies.  
Based on this analysis, predict how the user would perceive the serendipity of these lists.  

Summarize the serendipity across the lists by answering the question: **Were the movies across the lists unexpected yet interesting?**  
Consider variations in genre, themes, time periods, and other relevant aspects. Also, analyze whether the movies align with or diverge from the user's preferred movies.  

Then, based on a 6-point Likert scale (strongly disagree = -3, disagree = -2, slightly disagree = -1, slightly agree = 1, agree = 2, strongly agree = 3), choose the option for the whole batch of lists. Option 0 is not valid, DON'T select it.  

Deliver your descriptions of lists, comparison with preferred movies, overall serendipity summarization, and serendipity score for the entire batch in the following JSON format:  

{
    "list_A_description": string,            # Describe the serendipity of the movies in list A, noting differences and similarities with the preferred movies.
    "list_B_description": string,            # Describe the serendipity of the movies in list B, noting differences and similarities with the preferred movies.
    "list_C_description": string,            # Describe the serendipity of the movies in list C, noting differences and similarities with the preferred movies.
    "list_D_description": string,            # Describe the serendipity of the movies in list D, noting differences and similarities with the preferred movies.
    "list_E_description": string,            # Describe the serendipity of the movies in list E, noting differences and similarities with the preferred movies.
    "list_F_description": string,            # Describe the serendipity of the movies in list F, noting differences and similarities with the preferred movies.
    "preferred_movies_analysis": string,     # Analyze the preferred movies and describe their common themes, genres, and characteristics.
    "serendipity_summarization": string,     # Answer the question: Were the movies across the lists unexpected yet interesting? Consider serendipity within the lists and in relation to the preferred movies.
    "answer": int                            # Choose the option based on the 6-point Likert scale.
}

evaluations.prompt:
Preferred movies: 
TITLE: Aladdin (1992)
PLOT: A kind-hearted street urchin and a power-hungry Grand Vizier vie for a magic lamp that has the power to make their deepest wishes come true.

TITLE: Spider-Man: Far from Home (2019)
PLOT: Following the events of Avengers: Endgame (2019), Spider-Man must step up to take on new threats in a world that has changed forever.

TITLE: 102 Dalmatians (2000)
PLOT: Cruella DeVil gets out of prison and goes after the puppies once more.

TITLE: Charlie and the Chocolate Factory (2005)
PLOT: A young boy wins a tour through the most magnificent chocolate factory in the world, led by the world's most unusual candy maker.

TITLE: Iron Man 3 (2013)
PLOT: When Tony Stark's world is torn apart by a formidable terrorist called the Mandarin, he starts an odyssey of rebuilding and retribution.

TITLE: Jumanji (1995)
PLOT: When two kids find and play a magical board game, they release a man trapped in it for decades - and a host of dangers that can only be stopped by finishing the game.

TITLE: Jurassic World: Fallen Kingdom (2018)
PLOT: When the island's dormant volcano begins roaring to life, Owen and Claire mount a campaign to rescue the remaining dinosaurs from this extinction-level event.

TITLE: Guardians of the Galaxy 2 (2017)
PLOT: The Guardians struggle to keep together as a team while dealing with their personal family issues, notably Star-Lord's encounter with his father, the ambitious celestial being Ego.

TITLE: Superhero Movie (2008)
PLOT: Orphaned high school student Rick Riker is bitten by a radioactive dragonfly, develops super powers (except for the ability to fly), and becomes a hero.

TITLE: Thor (2011)
PLOT: The powerful but arrogant god Thor is cast out of Asgard to live amongst humans in Midgard (Earth), where he soon becomes one of their finest defenders.

TITLE: Zoolander (2001)
PLOT: At the end of his career, a clueless fashion model is brainwashed to kill the Prime Minister of Malaysia.

TITLE: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince (2009)
PLOT: As Harry Potter begins his sixth year at Hogwarts, he discovers an old book marked as "the property of the Half-Blood Prince" and begins to learn more about Lord Voldemort's dark past.

TITLE: The Hobbit: The Battle of the Five Armies (2014)
PLOT: Bilbo and company are forced to engage in a war against an array of combatants and keep the Lonely Mountain from falling into the hands of a rising darkness.

TITLE: Spider-Man (2002)
PLOT: After being bitten by a genetically-modified spider, a shy teenager gains spider-like abilities that he uses to fight injustice as a masked superhero and face a vengeful enemy.

TITLE: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2 (2011)
PLOT: Harry, Ron, and Hermione search for Voldemort's remaining Horcruxes in their effort to destroy the Dark Lord as the final battle rages on at Hogwarts.

TITLE: Incredibles, The (2004)
PLOT: While trying to lead a quiet suburban life, a family of undercover superheroes are forced into action to save the world.

TITLE: Avengers, The (2012)
PLOT: Earth's mightiest heroes must come together and learn to fight as a team if they are going to stop the mischievous Loki and his alien army from enslaving humanity.

TITLE: Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire (2005)
PLOT: Harry Potter finds himself competing in a hazardous tournament between rival schools of magic, but he is distracted by recurring nightmares.

TITLE: Lord of the Rings: The Return of the King, The (2003)
PLOT: Gandalf and Aragorn lead the World of Men against Sauron's army to draw his gaze from Frodo and Sam as they approach Mount Doom with the One Ring.

TITLE: Untitled Spider-Man Reboot (2017)
PLOT: Peter Parker balances his life as an ordinary high school student in Queens with his superhero alter-ego Spider-Man, and finds himself on the trail of a new menace prowling the skies of New York City.


List A:
TITLE: Saving Private Ryan (1998)
PLOT: Following the Normandy Landings, a group of U.S. soldiers go behind enemy lines to retrieve a paratrooper whose brothers have been killed in action.

TITLE: Mr. & Mrs. Smith (2005)
PLOT: A bored married couple is surprised to learn that they are both assassins hired by competing agencies to kill each other.

TITLE: Goodfellas (1990)
PLOT: The story of Henry Hill and his life in the mafia, covering his relationship with his wife Karen and his mob partners Jimmy Conway and Tommy DeVito.

TITLE: Rogue One: A Star Wars Story (2016)
PLOT: In a time of conflict, a group of unlikely heroes band together on a mission to steal the plans to the Death Star, the Empire's ultimate weapon of destruction.

TITLE: Ex Machina (2015)
PLOT: A young programmer is selected to participate in a ground-breaking experiment in synthetic intelligence by evaluating the human qualities of a highly advanced humanoid A.I.

TITLE: Pirates of the Caribbean: The Curse of the Black Pearl (2003)
PLOT: Blacksmith Will Turner teams up with eccentric pirate "Captain" Jack Sparrow to save his love, the governor's daughter, from Jack's former pirate allies, who are now undead.

TITLE: Up (2009)
PLOT: 78-year-old Carl Fredricksen travels to Paradise Falls in his house equipped with balloons, inadvertently taking a young stowaway.

TITLE: Monsters, Inc. (2001)
PLOT: In order to power the city, monsters have to scare children so that they scream. However, the children are toxic to the monsters, and after a child gets through, two monsters realize things may not be what they think.

TITLE: Fight Club (1999)
PLOT: An insomniac office worker and a devil-may-care soap maker form an underground fight club that evolves into much more.

TITLE: The Butterfly Effect (2004)
PLOT: Evan Treborn suffers blackouts during significant events of his life. As he grows up, he finds a way to remember these lost memories and a supernatural way to alter his life by reading his journal.


List B:
TITLE: Avengers: Infinity War - Part I (2018)
PLOT: The Avengers and their allies must be willing to sacrifice all in an attempt to defeat the powerful Thanos before his blitz of devastation and ruin puts an end to the universe.

TITLE: Hacksaw Ridge (2016)
PLOT: World War II American Army Medic Desmond T. Doss, serving during the Battle of Okinawa, refuses to kill people and becomes the first man in American history to receive the Medal of Honor without firing a shot.

TITLE: American Psycho (2000)
PLOT: A wealthy New York City investment banking executive, Patrick Bateman, hides his alternate psychopathic ego from his co-workers and friends as he delves deeper into his violent, hedonistic fantasies.

TITLE: Maze Runner, The (2014)
PLOT: Thomas is deposited in a community of boys after his memory is erased, soon learning they're all trapped in a maze that will require him to join forces with fellow "runners" for a shot at escape.

TITLE: Spotlight (2015)
PLOT: The true story of how the Boston Globe uncovered the massive scandal of child molestation and cover-up within the local Catholic Archdiocese, shaking the entire Catholic Church to its core.

TITLE: Hell or High Water (2016)
PLOT: Toby is a divorced father who's trying to make a better life. His brother is an ex-con with a short temper and a loose trigger finger. Together, they plan a series of heists against the bank that's about to foreclose on their family ranch.

TITLE: Interstellar (2014)
PLOT: When Earth becomes uninhabitable in the future, a farmer and ex-NASA pilot, Joseph Cooper, is tasked to pilot a spacecraft, along with a team of researchers, to find a new planet for humans.

TITLE: Captain America: The Winter Soldier (2014)
PLOT: As Steve Rogers struggles to embrace his role in the modern world, he teams up with a fellow Avenger and S.H.I.E.L.D agent, Black Widow, to battle a new threat from history: an assassin known as the Winter Soldier.

TITLE: Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix (2007)
PLOT: With their warning about Lord Voldemort's return scoffed at, Harry and Dumbledore are targeted by the Wizard authorities as an authoritarian bureaucrat slowly seizes power at Hogwarts.

TITLE: Hugo (2011)
PLOT: In 1931 Paris, an orphan living in the walls of a train station gets wrapped up in a mystery involving his late father and an automaton.


List C:
TITLE: Sherlock Holmes (2009)
PLOT: Detective Sherlock Holmes and his stalwart partner Watson engage in a battle of wits and brawn with a nemesis whose plot is a threat to all of England.

TITLE: Dark Knight Rises, The (2012)
PLOT: Eight years after the Joker's reign of chaos, Batman is coerced out of exile with the assistance of the mysterious Selina Kyle in order to defend Gotham City from the vicious guerrilla terrorist Bane.

TITLE: Finding Dory (2016)
PLOT: Friendly but forgetful blue tang Dory begins a search for her long-lost parents and everyone learns a few things about the real meaning of family along the way.

TITLE: Secret Life of Walter Mitty, The (2013)
PLOT: When both he and a colleague are about to lose their job, Walter takes action by embarking on an adventure more extraordinary than anything he ever imagined.

TITLE: Inside Out (2015)
PLOT: After young Riley is uprooted from her Midwest life and moved to San Francisco, her emotions - Joy, Fear, Anger, Disgust, and Sadness - conflict on how best to navigate a new city, house, and school.

TITLE: Ant-Man (2015)
PLOT: Armed with a super-suit with the astonishing ability to shrink in scale but increase in strength, cat burglar Scott Lang must embrace his inner hero and help his mentor, Dr. Hank Pym, pull off a plan that will save the world.

TITLE: Crash (2004)
PLOT: Los Angeles citizens with vastly separate lives collide in interweaving stories of race, loss and redemption.

TITLE: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban (2004)
PLOT: Harry Potter, Ron and Hermione return to Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry for their third year of study, where they delve into the mystery surrounding an escaped prisoner who poses a dangerous threat to the young wizard.

TITLE: Constantine (2005)
PLOT: Supernatural exorcist and demonologist John Constantine helps a policewoman prove her sister's death was not a suicide, but something more.

TITLE: Toy Story 2 (1999)
PLOT: When Woody is stolen by a toy collector, Buzz and his friends set out on a rescue mission to save Woody before he becomes a museum toy property with his roundup gang Jessie, Prospector, and Bullseye.


List D:
TITLE: Kick-Ass (2010)
PLOT: Dave Lizewski is an unnoticed high school student and comic book fan who one day decides to become a superhero, even though he has no powers, training or meaningful reason to do so.

TITLE: Shaun of the Dead (2004)
PLOT: The uneventful, aimless lives of a London electronics salesman and his layabout roommate are disrupted by the zombie apocalypse.

TITLE: Princess Bride, The (1987)
PLOT: A bedridden boy's grandfather reads him the story of a farmboy-turned-pirate who encounters numerous obstacles, enemies and allies in his quest to be reunited with his true love.

TITLE: Home Alone (1990)
PLOT: An eight-year-old troublemaker, mistakenly left home alone, must defend his home against a pair of burglars on Christmas eve.

TITLE: Lord of the Rings: The Fellowship of the Ring, The (2001)
PLOT: A meek Hobbit from the Shire and eight companions set out on a journey to destroy the powerful One Ring and save Middle-earth from the Dark Lord Sauron.

TITLE: Fifth Element, The (1997)
PLOT: In the colorful future, a cab driver unwittingly becomes the central figure in the search for a legendary cosmic weapon to keep Evil and Mr. Zorg at bay.

TITLE: Pursuit of Happyness, The (2006)
PLOT: A struggling salesman takes custody of his son as he's poised to begin a life-changing professional career.

TITLE: Conjuring, The (2013)
PLOT: Paranormal investigators Ed and Lorraine Warren work to help a family terrorized by a dark presence in their farmhouse.

TITLE: The Boss Baby (2017)
PLOT: A suit-wearing, briefcase-carrying baby pairs up with his 7-year old brother to stop the dastardly plot of the CEO of Puppy Co.

TITLE: 300 (2007)
PLOT: King Leonidas of Sparta and a force of 300 men fight the Persians at Thermopylae in 480 B.C.


List E:
TITLE: Prisoners (2013)
PLOT: When Keller Dover's daughter and her friend go missing, he takes matters into his own hands as the police pursue multiple leads and the pressure mounts.

TITLE: Quantum of Solace (2008)
PLOT: James Bond descends into mystery as he tries to stop a mysterious organisation from eliminating a country's most valuable resource.

TITLE: In Bruges (2008)
PLOT: Guilt-stricken after a job gone wrong, hitman Ray and his partner await orders from their ruthless boss in Bruges, Belgium, the last place in the world Ray wants to be.

TITLE: Project X (2012)
PLOT: Three high-school seniors throw a birthday party to make a name for themselves. As the night progresses, things spiral out of control as word of the party spreads.

TITLE: Fugitive, The (1993)
PLOT: Dr. Richard Kimble, unjustly accused of murdering his wife, must find the real killer while being the target of a nationwide manhunt led by a seasoned U.S. Marshal.

TITLE: Indiana Jones and the Last Crusade (1989)
PLOT: In 1938, after his father goes missing while pursuing the Holy Grail, Indiana Jones finds himself up against the Nazis again to stop them from obtaining its powers.

TITLE: Ted (2012)
PLOT: John Bennett, a man whose childhood wish of bringing his teddy bear to life came true, now must decide between keeping the relationship with the bear, Ted or his girlfriend, Lori.

TITLE: The Hateful Eight (2015)
PLOT: In the dead of a Wyoming winter, a bounty hunter and his prisoner find shelter in a cabin currently inhabited by a collection of nefarious characters.

TITLE: Usual Suspects, The (1995)
PLOT: The sole survivor of a pier shoot-out tells the story of how a notorious criminal influenced the events that began with five criminals meeting in a seemingly random police lineup.

TITLE: Wall Street (1987)
PLOT: An impatient young stockbroker is willing to do anything to get to the top, including trading on illegal inside information taken through a ruthless, greedy corporate raider who takes the youth under his wing.


List F:
TITLE: Dead Poets Society (1989)
PLOT: Maverick teacher John Keating returns in 1959 to the prestigious New England boys' boarding school where he was once a star student, using poetry to embolden his pupils to new heights of self-expression.

TITLE: Life of Pi (2012)
PLOT: A young man who survives a disaster at sea is hurtled into an epic journey of adventure and discovery. While cast away, he forms an unexpected connection with another survivor: a fearsome Bengal tiger.

TITLE: The Hunger Games: Catching Fire (2013)
PLOT: Katniss Everdeen and Peeta Mellark become targets of the Capitol after their victory in the 74th Hunger Games sparks a rebellion in the Districts of Panem.

TITLE: Click (2006)
PLOT: A workaholic architect finds a universal remote that allows him to fast-forward and rewind to different parts of his life. Complications arise when the remote starts to overrule his choices.

TITLE: Guardians of the Galaxy (2014)
PLOT: A group of intergalactic criminals must pull together to stop a fanatical warrior with plans to purge the universe.

TITLE: Napoleon Dynamite (2004)
PLOT: A listless and alienated teenager decides to help his new friend win the class presidency in their small western high school, while he must deal with his bizarre family life back home.

TITLE: Green Book (2018)
PLOT: A working-class Italian-American bouncer becomes the driver for an African-American classical pianist on a tour of venues through the 1960s American South.

TITLE: Best in Show (2000)
PLOT: A behind-the-scenes look into the highly competitive and cut-throat world of dog shows through the eyes of a group of ruthless dog owners.

TITLE: Toy Story 3 (2010)
PLOT: The toys are mistakenly delivered to a day-care center instead of the attic right before Andy leaves for college, and it's up to Woody to convince the other toys that they weren't abandoned and to return home.

TITLE: Rain Man (1988)
PLOT: After a selfish L.A. yuppie learns his estranged father left a fortune to an autistic-savant brother in Ohio that he didn't know existed, he absconds with his brother and sets out across the country, hoping to gain a larger inheritance.

response.list_A_description: List A shows some unexpected pairings. While some films like Saving Private Ryan and Goodfellas align with the user's taste for action and drama, others like Up and Monsters Inc. represent a shift towards animation and family-friendly themes.  The inclusion of Ex Machina and Fight Club adds a layer of sci-fi and psychological thriller, which are not prominently featured in the preferred movies. Overall, the list presents a diverse range of genres and tones, making it somewhat serendipitous.
response.list_B_description: List B leans heavily towards action and superhero genres, with titles like Avengers: Infinity War and Captain America: The Winter Soldier directly echoing the user's preference for such films. However, the inclusion of films like Hacksaw Ridge and Spotlight introduces unexpected elements of war drama and investigative journalism, creating a blend of familiar and unfamiliar genres. The overall serendipity is moderate, as the list maintains a core alignment with the user's preferences while introducing some surprising elements.
response.list_C_description: List C is a mixed bag. While films like Sherlock Holmes and The Dark Knight Rises align with the user's preference for action and superhero themes, others like Finding Dory and Inside Out represent a significant shift towards animation and family-friendly content. The inclusion of films like Crash and Constantine adds a layer of drama and supernatural elements, which are not prominently featured in the preferred movies. The serendipity is moderate, with a balance of expected and unexpected choices.
response.list_D_description: List D presents a diverse range of genres and tones, making it quite serendipitous. While some films like Home Alone and The Lord of the Rings: The Fellowship of the Ring might align with the user's taste for family-friendly adventures and fantasy, others like Kick-Ass and Shaun of the Dead represent a shift towards dark comedy and action. The inclusion of films like The Fifth Element and 300 adds a layer of sci-fi and historical action, which are not prominently featured in the preferred movies. The list's unexpected yet interesting nature makes it highly serendipitous.
response.list_E_description: List E is more focused on action and thriller genres, with titles like Prisoners and The Fugitive aligning with the user's preference for suspenseful narratives. However, the inclusion of films like Project X and Ted introduces unexpected elements of comedy and raunchy humor, creating a blend of familiar and unfamiliar genres. The overall serendipity is moderate, as the list maintains a core alignment with the user's preferences while introducing some surprising elements.
response.list_F_description: List F is a highly serendipitous list. While some films like The Hunger Games: Catching Fire and Toy Story 3 align with the user's taste for action-adventure and animation, others like Napoleon Dynamite and Best in Show represent a significant shift towards independent comedy and quirky humor. The inclusion of films like Life of Pi and Green Book adds a layer of drama and social commentary, which are not prominently featured in the preferred movies. The list's unexpected yet interesting nature makes it highly serendipitous.
response.preferred_movies_analysis: The preferred movies showcase a diverse range of genres, including animation (Aladdin, 102 Dalmatians, Charlie and the Chocolate Factory, Monsters Inc., Toy Story 3), superhero films (Spider-Man series, Iron Man 3, Avengers, Guardians of the Galaxy), fantasy (Jumanji, Harry Potter series, Lord of the Rings, The Hobbit), and comedy (Zoolander, Superhero Movie).  There's a clear preference for action-packed adventures and family-friendly entertainment, with a sprinkling of darker, more mature themes in some superhero and fantasy films.
response.serendipity_summarization: The movies across the lists were, to varying degrees, unexpected yet interesting. Some lists leaned heavily on familiar genres (action, superhero), while others offered a more diverse range, including animation, dark comedy, and independent films.  The serendipity was enhanced by the unexpected pairings and the introduction of genres not prominently featured in the user's preferred movies.  While some lists maintained a core alignment with the user's preferences, others offered a more significant departure, leading to a mixed but generally positive experience.

evaluations.prompt:

PLOT: Cruella DeVil gets out of prison and goes after the puppies once more.

PLOT: Bilbo and company are forced to engage in a war against an array of combatants and keep the Lonely Mountain from falling into the hands of a rising darkness.

TITLE: Spider-Man (2002)
PLOT: After being bitten by a genetically-modified spider, a shy teenager gains spider-like abilities that he uses to fight injustice as a masked superhero and face a vengeful enemy.

TITLE: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2 (2011)
PLOT: Harry, Ron, and Hermione search for Voldemort's remaining Horcruxes in their effort to destroy the Dark Lord as the final battle rages on at Hogwarts.

TITLE: Incredibles, The (2004)
PLOT: While trying to lead a quiet suburban life, a family of undercover superheroes are forced into action to save the world.

TITLE: Avengers, The (2012)
PLOT: Earth's mightiest heroes must come together and learn to fight as a team if they are going to stop the mischievous Loki and his alien army from enslaving humanity.

TITLE: Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire (2005)
PLOT: Harry Potter finds himself competing in a hazardous tournament between rival schools of magic, but he is distracted by recurring nightmares.

TITLE: Lord of the Rings: The Return of the King, The (2003)
PLOT: Gandalf and Aragorn lead the World of Men against Sauron's army to draw his gaze from Frodo and Sam as they approach Mount Doom with the One Ring.

TITLE: Untitled Spider-Man Reboot (2017)
PLOT: Peter Parker balances his life as an ordinary high school student in Queens with his superhero alter-ego Spider-Man, and finds himself on the trail of a new menace prowling the skies of New York City.


List A:
TITLE: Phone Booth (2002)
PLOT: Publicist Stuart Shepard finds himself trapped in a phone booth, pinned down by an extortionist's sniper rifle. Unable to leave or receive outside help, Stuart's negotiation with the caller leads to a jaw-dropping climax.

TITLE: Spy Kids (2001)
PLOT: Using high tech gadgets, two kids have to save their reactivated OSS top spy parents when they're taken by an evil, high tech enemy.

TITLE: Hotel Transylvania (2012)
PLOT: Dracula, who operates a high-end resort away from the human world, goes into overprotective mode when a boy discovers the resort and falls for the count's teenaged daughter.

TITLE: The Interview (2014)
PLOT: Dave Skylark and his producer Aaron Rapaport run the celebrity tabloid show "Skylark Tonight". When they land an interview with a surprise fan, North Korean dictator Jong-Un Kim, they are recruited by the CIA to assassinate him.

TITLE: Finding Neverland (2004)
PLOT: The story of Sir J.M. Barrie's friendship with a family who inspired him to create Peter Pan.

TITLE: Bourne Legacy, The (2012)
PLOT: An expansion of the universe from Robert Ludlum's novels, centered on a new hero whose stakes have been triggered by the events of the previous three films.

TITLE: 101 Dalmatians (1996)
PLOT: An evil high-fashion designer plots to steal dalmatian puppies in order to make an extravagant fur coat but creates an extravagant mess instead.

TITLE: 10 Cloverfield Lane (2016)
PLOT: A young woman is held in an underground bunker by a man who insists that a hostile event has left the surface of the Earth uninhabitable.

TITLE: Lara Croft Tomb Raider: The Cradle of Life (2003)
PLOT: Adventurer Lara Croft goes on a quest to save the mythical Pandora's Box, before an evil scientist finds it, and recruits a former Marine turned mercenary to assist her.

TITLE: Bridesmaids (2011)
PLOT: Competition between the maid of honor and a bridesmaid, over who is the bride's best friend, threatens to upend the life of an out-of-work pastry chef.


List B:
TITLE: Hunt for Red October, The (1990)
PLOT: In November 1984, the Soviet Union's best submarine captain violates orders and heads for the U.S. in a new undetectable sub. The American CIA and military must quickly determine: Is he trying to defect or to start a war?

TITLE: Sinister (2012)
PLOT: A controversial true crime writer finds a box of super 8 home movies in his new home, revealing that the murder case he is currently researching could be the work of an unknown serial killer whose legacy dates back to the 1960s.

TITLE: Your Name. (2016)
PLOT: Two teenagers share a profound, magical connection upon discovering they are swapping bodies. Things manage to become even more complicated when the boy and girl decide to meet in person.

TITLE: Tourist, The (2010)
PLOT: Revolves around Frank, an American tourist visiting Italy to mend a broken heart. Elise is an extraordinary woman who deliberately crosses his path.

TITLE: Scary Stories to Tell in the Dark (2019)
PLOT: On Halloween 1968, Stella and her two friends meet a mysterious drifter, Ramón, and uncover a sinister notebook of stories.

TITLE: Planet Earth II (2016)
PLOT: David Attenborough returns with a new wildlife documentary that shows life in a variety of habitats.

TITLE: The Boss Baby (2017)
PLOT: A suit-wearing, briefcase-carrying baby pairs up with his 7-year old brother to stop the dastardly plot of the CEO of Puppy Co.

TITLE: Best in Show (2000)
PLOT: A behind-the-scenes look into the highly competitive and cut-throat world of dog shows through the eyes of a group of ruthless dog owners.

TITLE: Project X (2012)
PLOT: Three high-school seniors throw a birthday party to make a name for themselves. As the night progresses, things spiral out of control as word of the party spreads.

TITLE: El Camino: A Breaking Bad Movie (2019)
PLOT: Fugitive Jesse Pinkman runs from his captors, the law, and his past.


List C:
TITLE: Goodfellas (1990)
PLOT: The story of Henry Hill and his life in the mafia, covering his relationship with his wife Karen and his mob partners Jimmy Conway and Tommy DeVito.

TITLE: Kubo and the Two Strings (2016)
PLOT: A young boy named Kubo must locate a magical suit of armour worn by his late father in order to defeat a vengeful spirit from the past.

TITLE: Secret Window (2004)
PLOT: A successful writer in the midst of a painful divorce is stalked at his remote lake house by a would-be scribe who accuses him of plagiarism.

TITLE: Percy Jackson & the Olympians: The Lightning Thief (2010)
PLOT: A teenager discovers he's the descendant of a Greek god and sets out on an adventure to settle an on-going battle between the gods.

TITLE: Once Upon a Time in Hollywood (2019)
PLOT: A faded television actor and his stunt double strive to achieve fame and success in the final years of Hollywood's Golden Age in 1969 Los Angeles.

TITLE: Air Force One (1997)
PLOT: Communist radicals hijack Air Force One with the U.S. President and his family on board. The Vice President negotiates from Washington D.C., while the President, a veteran, fights to rescue the hostages on board.

TITLE: Hacksaw Ridge (2016)
PLOT: World War II American Army Medic Desmond T. Doss, serving during the Battle of Okinawa, refuses to kill people and becomes the first man in American history to receive the Medal of Honor without firing a shot.

TITLE: Man from Earth, The (2007)
PLOT: An impromptu goodbye party for Professor John Oldman becomes a mysterious interrogation after the retiring scholar reveals to his colleagues he has a longer and stranger past than they can imagine.

TITLE: Conjuring, The (2013)
PLOT: Paranormal investigators Ed and Lorraine Warren work to help a family terrorized by a dark presence in their farmhouse.

TITLE: Cruel Intentions (1999)
PLOT: Two vicious step-siblings of an elite Manhattan prep school make a wager: to deflower the new headmaster's daughter before the start of term.


List D:
TITLE: Citizenfour (2014)
PLOT: A documentarian and a reporter travel to Hong Kong for the first of many meetings with Edward Snowden.

TITLE: Body of Lies (2008)
PLOT: A CIA agent on the ground in Jordan hunts down a powerful terrorist leader while being caught between the unclear intentions of his American supervisors and Jordan Intelligence.

TITLE: Wall Street (1987)
PLOT: An impatient young stockbroker is willing to do anything to get to the top, including trading on illegal inside information taken through a ruthless, greedy corporate raider who takes the youth under his wing.

TITLE: Band of Brothers (2001)
PLOT: The story of Easy Company of the U.S. Army 101st Airborne Division and their mission in World War II Europe, from Operation Overlord to V-J Day.

TITLE: Ray (2004)
PLOT: The story of the life and career of the legendary rhythm and blues musician Ray Charles, from his humble beginnings in the South, where he went blind at age seven, to his meteoric rise to stardom during the 1950s and 1960s.

TITLE: Hell or High Water (2016)
PLOT: Toby is a divorced father who's trying to make a better life. His brother is an ex-con with a short temper and a loose trigger finger. Together, they plan a series of heists against the bank that's about to foreclose on their family ranch.

TITLE: Brazil (1985)
PLOT: A bureaucrat in a dystopic society becomes an enemy of the state as he pursues the woman of his dreams.

TITLE: Cinderella Man (2005)
PLOT: The story of James J. Braddock, a supposedly washed-up boxer who came back to challenge for the heavyweight championship of the world.

TITLE: Patriot Games (1992)
PLOT: When CIA analyst Jack Ryan interferes with an IRA assassination, a renegade faction targets him and his family for revenge.

TITLE: Scanner Darkly, A (2006)
PLOT: An undercover cop in a not-too-distant future becomes involved with a dangerous new drug and begins to lose his own identity as a result.


List E:
TITLE: King Arthur: Legend of the Sword (2017)
PLOT: Robbed of his birthright, Arthur comes up the hard way in the back alleys of the city. But once he pulls the sword from the stone, he is forced to acknowledge his true legacy - whether he likes it or not.

TITLE: Father of the Bride (1991)
PLOT: With his oldest daughter's wedding approaching, a father finds himself reluctant to let go.

TITLE: Borat Subsequent Moviefilm (2020)
PLOT: Borat returns to America from Kazakhstan to America, this time to reveal more about the American culture, the COVD-19 pandemic, and the political elections.

TITLE: Delicatessen (1991)
PLOT: Post-apocalyptic surrealist black comedy about the landlord of an apartment building who occasionally prepares a delicacy for his odd tenants.

TITLE: Exam (2009)
PLOT: Eight candidates for a highly desirable corporate job are locked together in an exam room and given a final test with just one seemingly simple question. However, it doesn't take long for confusion to ensue and tensions to unravel.

TITLE: Wonder (2017)
PLOT: Based on the New York Times bestseller, this movie tells the incredibly inspiring and heartwarming story of August Pullman, a boy with facial differences who enters the fifth grade, attending a mainstream elementary school for the first time.

TITLE: The Raid 2: Berandal (2014)
PLOT: Only a short time after the first raid, Rama goes undercover with the thugs of Jakarta and plans to bring down the syndicate and uncover the corruption within his police force.

TITLE: Bridget Jones: The Edge of Reason (2004)
PLOT: After finding love, Bridget Jones questions if she really has everything she'd ever dreamed of having.

TITLE: 12 Angry Men (1997)
PLOT: Twelve men must decide the fate of one when one juror objects to the jury's decision.

TITLE: Tank Girl (1995)
PLOT: A girl is among the few survivors of a dystopian Earth. Riding a war tank, she fights against the tyranny of a mega-corporation that dominates the remaining potable water supply of the planet.


List F:
TITLE: Ford v. Ferrari (2019)
PLOT: American car designer Carroll Shelby and driver Ken Miles battle corporate interference and the laws of physics to build a revolutionary race car for Ford in order to defeat Ferrari at the 24 Hours of Le Mans in 1966.

TITLE: Sphere (1998)
PLOT: A spaceship is discovered under three hundred years' worth of coral growth at the bottom of the ocean.

TITLE: Happy Death Day (2017)
PLOT: A college student must relive the day of her murder over and over again, in a loop that will end only when she discovers her killer's identity.

TITLE: Four Weddings and a Funeral (1994)
PLOT: Over the course of five social occasions, a committed bachelor must consider the notion that he may have discovered love.

TITLE: Mr. Nobody (2009)
PLOT: A boy stands on a station platform as a train is about to leave. Should he go with his mother or stay with his father? Infinite possibilities arise from this decision. As long as he doesn't choose, anything is possible.

TITLE: The Magnificent Seven (2016)
PLOT: Seven gunmen from a variety of backgrounds are brought together by a vengeful young widow to protect her town from the private army of a destructive industrialist.

TITLE: Julie & Julia (2009)
PLOT: Julia Child's story of her start in the cooking profession is intertwined with blogger Julie Powell's 2002 challenge to cook all the recipes in Child's first book.

TITLE: The Two Popes (2019)
PLOT: Behind Vatican walls, the conservative Pope Benedict XVI and the liberal future Pope Francis must find common ground to forge a new path for the Catholic Church.

TITLE: Last Emperor, The (1987)
PLOT: Bernardo Bertolucci's Oscar-winning dramatisation of the life story of China's last emperor, Pu Yi.

TITLE: Richard Jewell (2019)
PLOT: Security guard Richard Jewell is an instant hero after foiling a bomb attack at the 1996 Atlanta Olympics, but his life becomes a nightmare when the FBI leaks to the media that he is a suspect in the case.

response.list_A_description: List A shows moderate serendipity.  While it includes some family-friendly movies like "Spy Kids" and "Hotel Transylvania", which differ from the preferred movies' focus on action and superheroes, it also contains thrillers like "Phone Booth" and "10 Cloverfield Lane", and dramas like "Finding Neverland". The inclusion of "101 Dalmatians" (live-action) shows some thematic overlap with the preferred movies, but overall, the list is quite diverse.
response.list_B_description: List B presents a mixed bag.  The inclusion of "Your Name.", an anime, and "Planet Earth II", a documentary, are unexpected compared to the preferred movies.  However, the presence of action movies like "Hunt for Red October" and "El Camino" shows some alignment with the user's preference for action and adventure. The overall serendipity is moderate.
response.list_C_description: List C is less serendipitous.  While it contains some critically acclaimed films like "Goodfellas" and "Once Upon a Time in Hollywood", the list leans heavily towards crime dramas and action movies, which is somewhat consistent with the user's preferences, but lacks the unexpected variety seen in other lists. The inclusion of "Kubo and the Two Strings" is a notable exception, offering a different genre.
response.list_D_description: List D exhibits low serendipity.  The list is dominated by biographical dramas and war films ("Ray", "Band of Brothers", "Hacksaw Ridge"), which are not strongly represented in the preferred movies. While some action elements are present in films like "Body of Lies" and "Patriot Games", the overall lack of variety and divergence from preferred movie genres makes the list less serendipitous.
response.list_E_description: List E demonstrates high serendipity.  The list is highly diverse, including a fantasy film ("King Arthur"), a comedy ("Father of the Bride"), a mockumentary ("Borat"), a surrealist film ("Delicatessen"), a thriller ("Exam"), a drama ("Wonder"), an action film ("The Raid 2"), a romantic comedy ("Bridget Jones"), and a courtroom drama ("12 Angry Men"). This unexpected variety contrasts sharply with the user's preferred movies, making it a highly serendipitous list.
response.list_F_description: List F shows moderate serendipity.  The list includes a mix of genres, including biographical dramas ("The Two Popes", "Richard Jewell"), historical dramas ("The Last Emperor", "Ford v Ferrari"), comedies ("Four Weddings and a Funeral", "Julie & Julia"), and thrillers ("Happy Death Day", "Sphere").  The inclusion of "The Magnificent Seven" shows some thematic overlap with the preferred movies' action and adventure themes. The overall variety is moderate.
response.preferred_movies_analysis: The preferred movies show a clear preference for action, adventure, superhero, and family-friendly films with a touch of fantasy and comedy.  There's a strong representation of blockbuster movies and popular franchises like Spider-Man, Harry Potter, and Marvel Cinematic Universe.
response.serendipity_summarization: The movies across the lists showed varying degrees of serendipity. Lists A, B, and F offered a moderate level of unexpectedness and interest, blending familiar genres with some surprising inclusions. List C was less serendipitous, sticking closer to the user's apparent preference for action and crime. List D was the least serendipitous, featuring a collection of films that diverged significantly from the user's preferred style. List E, however, stood out as highly serendipitous, offering a diverse range of genres and styles that were unexpected yet engaging.

evaluations.prompt:
Preferred movies: 
TITLE: Aladdin (1992)
PLOT: A kind-hearted street urchin and a power-hungry Grand Vizier vie for a magic lamp that has the power to make their deepest wishes come true.

TITLE: Spider-Man: Far from Home (2019)
PLOT: Following the events of Avengers: Endgame (2019), Spider-Man must step up to take on new threats in a world that has changed forever.

TITLE: 102 Dalmatians (2000)
PLOT: Cruella DeVil gets out of prison and goes after the puppies once more.

TITLE: Charlie and the Chocolate Factory (2005)
PLOT: A young boy wins a tour through the most magnificent chocolate factory in the world, led by the world's most unusual candy maker.

TITLE: Iron Man 3 (2013)
PLOT: When Tony Stark's world is torn apart by a formidable terrorist called the Mandarin, he starts an odyssey of rebuilding and retribution.

TITLE: Jumanji (1995)
PLOT: When two kids find and play a magical board game, they release a man trapped in it for decades - and a host of dangers that can only be stopped by finishing the game.

TITLE: Jurassic World: Fallen Kingdom (2018)
PLOT: When the island's dormant volcano begins roaring to life, Owen and Claire mount a campaign to rescue the remaining dinosaurs from this extinction-level event.

TITLE: Guardians of the Galaxy 2 (2017)
PLOT: The Guardians struggle to keep together as a team while dealing with their personal family issues, notably Star-Lord's encounter with his father, the ambitious celestial being Ego.

TITLE: Superhero Movie (2008)
PLOT: Orphaned high school student Rick Riker is bitten by a radioactive dragonfly, develops super powers (except for the ability to fly), and becomes a hero.

TITLE: Thor (2011)
PLOT: The powerful but arrogant god Thor is cast out of Asgard to live amongst humans in Midgard (Earth), where he soon becomes one of their finest defenders.

TITLE: Zoolander (2001)
PLOT: At the end of his career, a clueless fashion model is brainwashed to kill the Prime Minister of Malaysia.

TITLE: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince (2009)
PLOT: As Harry Potter begins his sixth year at Hogwarts, he discovers an old book marked as "the property of the Half-Blood Prince" and begins to learn more about Lord Voldemort's dark past.

TITLE: The Hobbit: The Battle of the Five Armies (2014)
PLOT: Bilbo and company are forced to engage in a war against an array of combatants and keep the Lonely Mountain from falling into the hands of a rising darkness.

TITLE: Spider-Man (2002)
PLOT: After being bitten by a genetically-modified spider, a shy teenager gains spider-like abilities that he uses to fight injustice as a masked superhero and face a vengeful enemy.

TITLE: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2 (2011)
PLOT: Harry, Ron, and Hermione search for Voldemort's remaining Horcruxes in their effort to destroy the Dark Lord as the final battle rages on at Hogwarts.

TITLE: Incredibles, The (2004)
PLOT: While trying to lead a quiet suburban life, a family of undercover superheroes are forced into action to save the world.

TITLE: Avengers, The (2012)
PLOT: Earth's mightiest heroes must come together and learn to fight as a team if they are going to stop the mischievous Loki and his alien army from enslaving humanity.

TITLE: Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire (2005)
PLOT: Harry Potter finds himself competing in a hazardous tournament between rival schools of magic, but he is distracted by recurring nightmares.

TITLE: Lord of the Rings: The Return of the King, The (2003)
PLOT: Gandalf and Aragorn lead the World of Men against Sauron's army to draw his gaze from Frodo and Sam as they approach Mount Doom with the One Ring.

TITLE: Untitled Spider-Man Reboot (2017)
PLOT: Peter Parker balances his life as an ordinary high school student in Queens with his superhero alter-ego Spider-Man, and finds himself on the trail of a new menace prowling the skies of New York City.


List A:
TITLE: The Boss Baby (2017)
PLOT: A suit-wearing, briefcase-carrying baby pairs up with his 7-year old brother to stop the dastardly plot of the CEO of Puppy Co.

TITLE: Carnival of Souls (1998)
PLOT: A young girl witnesses the brutal rape and murder of her mother by a circus clown and begins to have nightmares when the carnival comes back to town when she is an adult.

TITLE: Aferim! (2015)
PLOT: Set in early 19th century Romania, a policeman, Costandin, is hired by a nobleman to find a Gypsy slave who has run away from his estate after having an affair with his wife.

TITLE: The Diary of Anne Frank (2009)
PLOT: During World War II, a teenage Jewish girl named Anne Frank and her family are forced into hiding in the Nazi-occupied Netherlands.

TITLE: Peculiarities of the National Ice Fishing (2007)
PLOT: 

TITLE: Sonu Ke Titu Ki Sweety (2018)
PLOT: Titu is going to marry a perfect woman named Sweety. Titu's best-friend Sonu doubts Sweety's character and tries to break the marriage while Sweety tries to do opposite and which leads to war between Bromance and Romance.

TITLE: Look, Up in the Sky! The Amazing Story of Superman (2006)
PLOT: The history of the comic book superhero, Superman in his various media incarnations.

TITLE: The Whiskey Bandit (2017)
PLOT: A rootless young man in Ceausescu's Romania crosses the Hungarian border looking for a better future. With his back against the wall in the post-socialist turmoil, he becomes the most successful bank robber in Hungarian history.

TITLE: Rubble Kings (2015)
PLOT: Through archival footage Nicholson tells the story of the real Warriors that walked the streets of New York City in the 1970s and the harsh reality of gang life in a city that seemed to be falling apart.

TITLE: Scary Stories to Tell in the Dark (2019)
PLOT: On Halloween 1968, Stella and her two friends meet a mysterious drifter, Ramón, and uncover a sinister notebook of stories.


List B:
TITLE: Bronx Tale, A (1993)
PLOT: Robert De Niro and Chazz Palminteri give captivating performances in this intense drama about a boy torn between his tough, hard-working father and a violent yet charismatic crime boss.

TITLE: Hollow in the Land (2017)
PLOT: A woman with a troubled past sets out to find her missing brother.

TITLE: Recep İvedik 3 (2010)
PLOT: Recep Ivedik has been depressed since the death of his grandmother. Everyone who tries to help him fails. A young girl named Zeynep, who can't find an apartment, stays with Recep. Initially, the two can't stand each others but after a while, they grow close. Despite many adventures together, Recep's depression won't go away.

TITLE: Root of All Evil? (2006)
PLOT: Richard Dawkins' highly critical documentary attacks the pulsing heart of all mainstream religion- faith; with special focus on Islam, Judaism, and Christianity. Contains repeated references to sectorial schools as child abuse and faith as the stepping stone to terrorist activity.—kwedgwood@hotmail.com

TITLE: The Dead Center (2018)
PLOT: A hospital psychiatrist's own sanity is pushed to the edge when a frightened amnesiac patient insists that he has died and brought something terrible back from the other side.

TITLE: Sällskapsresan II - Snowroller (1985)
PLOT: Stig Helmer takes another vacation with his Norwegian friend Ole, this time a skiing vacation in the Alps. Of course, Stig has never learned downhill skiing, but he attends a ski school. The two men also manage to charm two women who are also vacationing. The other Swedish tourists are a diverse group that includes the choleric Mr. Jönsson and his family, and two men trying to sell kick-sleds.—Mattias Thuresson

TITLE: Stranded (2013)
PLOT: Four astronauts working at a lunar base suffer a meteor strike that brings an infection that leads to paranoia, fear and death.

TITLE: Prescription Thugs (2016)
PLOT: In this follow-up to his film BIGGER FASTER STRONGER, director Chris Bell turns his camera on the abuse of prescription drugs and, ultimately, himself. As Bell learns more about Big Pharma, an industry he had been brought up to trust, he falls down his own hole of addiction.

TITLE: Fred: The Movie (2010)
PLOT: Lovestruck, awkward teen Fred Figglehorn makes desperate attempts to make Judy fall in love with him - while also dodging the mischievous Kevin.

TITLE: It's Christmastime Again, Charlie Brown (1992)
PLOT: The Peanuts gang prepares for the holidays in their own unique ways.


List C:
TITLE: The Lobster (2015)
PLOT: In a dystopian near future, according to the laws of The City, single people are taken to The Hotel, where they are obliged to find a romantic partner in 45 days or they're transformed into beasts and sent off into The Woods.

TITLE: Crown for Christmas (2015)
PLOT: After getting fired from her job as a maid at a ritzy New York City hotel, Allie reluctantly accepts a temporary gig as the governess to a young girl who is part of a powerful family in Europe that lives in a castle.

TITLE: Scooby-Doo! Abracadabra-Doo (2010)
PLOT: The gang goes on a trip to check on Velma's younger sister, Madelyn. She's been studying stage magic at the Whirlen Merlin Magic Academy, where apparently there have been sightings of a giant griffin. The gang decides to investigate.

TITLE: Saving Capitalism (2017)
PLOT: SAVING CAPITALISM is a documentary film that follows former Secretary of Labor and Professor, Robert Reich, as he takes his book and his views to the heart of conservative America to speak about our economic system and present big ideas for how to fix it.

TITLE: The Wedding Plan (2017)
PLOT: When her fiancé bows out on the eve of her wedding, Michal refuses to cancel the wedding arrangements. An Orthodox Jew, she insists that God will supply her a husband. As the clock ticks down.

TITLE: Michael Bolton's Big, Sexy Valentine's Day Special (2017)
PLOT: After Santa tells Michael Bolton that he needs 75,000 new babies by Christmas to meet toy supply, Michael Bolton hosts a sexy telethon to get the world to start making love.

TITLE: Hannibal Buress: Animal Furnace (2012)
PLOT: Hannibal's a Chicago native, currently living in New York City where he regularly performs and lives alone with no pets. His credits include writing for 30 Rock, SNL and performing in several basements of bars in NYC and Chicago.

TITLE: Ricky Gervais: Out of England 2 - The Stand-Up Special (2010)
PLOT: Stand-up comedian Ricky Gervais in his second HBO special.

TITLE: Hum Saath Saath Hain (1999)
PLOT: Ramkishen and Mamta have three sons Vivek , Prem and Vinod and a daughter Sangeeta. This family is part of a joint family whose close knit bond is challenged by a misunderstanding.

TITLE: Donbass (2018)
PLOT: In eastern Ukraine, society begins to degrade as the effects of propaganda and manipulation begin to surface in this post-truth era.


List D:
TITLE: Hacksaw Ridge (2016)
PLOT: World War II American Army Medic Desmond T. Doss, serving during the Battle of Okinawa, refuses to kill people and becomes the first man in American history to receive the Medal of Honor without firing a shot.

TITLE: Where the Wild Things Are (2009)
PLOT: Yearning for escape and adventure, a young boy runs away from home and sails to an island filled with creatures that take him in as their king.

TITLE: Sphere (1998)
PLOT: A spaceship is discovered under three hundred years' worth of coral growth at the bottom of the ocean.

TITLE: Notebook, The (2004)
PLOT: A poor yet passionate young man falls in love with a rich young woman, giving her a sense of freedom. However, social differences soon get in the way.

TITLE: The African Doctor (2016)
PLOT: The story of Seyolo Zantoko, who as a freshly graduated doctor of Congolese descent in France, struggled with his family to integrate in a small rural village, and ended up being considered as one of the most respected doctors in the area.

TITLE: Pirates of the Caribbean: Dead Men Tell No Tales (2017)
PLOT: Captain Jack Sparrow is pursued by old rival Captain Salazar and a crew of deadly ghosts who have escaped from the Devil's Triangle. They're determined to kill every pirate at sea...notably Jack.

TITLE: Raising Arizona (1987)
PLOT: When a childless couple--an ex-con and an ex-cop--decide to help themselves to one of another family's quintuplets, their lives become more complicated than they anticipated.

TITLE: The Work (2017)
PLOT: Set inside a single room in Folsom Prison, three men from the outside participate in a four-day group-therapy retreat with a group of incarcerated men for a real look at the challenges of rehabilitation.

TITLE: Role Models (2008)
PLOT: Wild behavior forces a pair of energy drink reps to enroll in a Big Brother program.

TITLE: Song of the Sea (2014)
PLOT: Ben, a young Irish boy, and his little sister Saoirse, a girl who can turn into a seal, go on an adventure to free the fairies and save the spirit world.


List E:
TITLE: Bourne Identity, The (2002)
PLOT: A man is picked up by a fishing boat, bullet-riddled and suffering from amnesia, before racing to elude assassins and attempting to regain his memory.

TITLE: Up (2009)
PLOT: 78-year-old Carl Fredricksen travels to Paradise Falls in his house equipped with balloons, inadvertently taking a young stowaway.

TITLE: Inside Out (2015)
PLOT: After young Riley is uprooted from her Midwest life and moved to San Francisco, her emotions - Joy, Fear, Anger, Disgust, and Sadness - conflict on how best to navigate a new city, house, and school.

TITLE: Monsters, Inc. (2001)
PLOT: In order to power the city, monsters have to scare children so that they scream. However, the children are toxic to the monsters, and after a child gets through, two monsters realize things may not be what they think.

TITLE: Mulan (1998)
PLOT: To save her father from death in the army, a young maiden secretly goes in his place and becomes one of China's greatest heroines in the process.

TITLE: Lord of War (2005)
PLOT: An arms dealer confronts the morality of his work as he is being chased by an INTERPOL Agent.

TITLE: Gone Girl (2014)
PLOT: With his wife's disappearance having become the focus of an intense media circus, a man sees the spotlight turned on him when it's suspected that he may not be innocent.

TITLE: 300 (2007)
PLOT: King Leonidas of Sparta and a force of 300 men fight the Persians at Thermopylae in 480 B.C.

TITLE: Matrix, The (1999)
PLOT: When a beautiful stranger leads computer hacker Neo to a forbidding underworld, he discovers the shocking truth--the life he knows is the elaborate deception of an evil cyber-intelligence.

TITLE: Captain America: The Winter Soldier (2014)
PLOT: As Steve Rogers struggles to embrace his role in the modern world, he teams up with a fellow Avenger and S.H.I.E.L.D agent, Black Widow, to battle a new threat from history: an assassin known as the Winter Soldier.


List F:
TITLE: Usual Suspects, The (1995)
PLOT: The sole survivor of a pier shoot-out tells the story of how a notorious criminal influenced the events that began with five criminals meeting in a seemingly random police lineup.

TITLE: One Hundredth of a Second (2006)
PLOT: Kate is a talented photojournalist. She risks her life to deliver powerful images to the waiting world until a photograph of a Girl changes her life forever.

TITLE: Valerian and the City of a Thousand Planets (2017)
PLOT: A dark force threatens Alpha, a vast metropolis and home to species from a thousand planets. Special operatives Valerian and Laureline must race to identify the marauding menace and safeguard not just Alpha, but the future of the universe.

TITLE: Sully (2016)
PLOT: When pilot Chesley "Sully" Sullenberger lands his damaged plane on the Hudson River in order to save the flight's passengers and crew, some consider him a hero while others think he was reckless.

TITLE: Black Box (2020)
PLOT: After losing his wife and his memory in a car accident, a single father undergoes an agonizing experimental treatment that causes him to question who he really is.

TITLE: Dilwale (2015)
PLOT: The siblings of two estranged lovers fall for each other, unaware of the violent past that drove them apart.

TITLE: Hunchback of Notre Dame, The (1996)
PLOT: A deformed bell-ringer must assert his independence from a vicious government minister in order to help his friend, a gypsy dancer.

TITLE: Travellers and Magicians (2003)
PLOT: The two men embark on parallel, if separate, journeys. Their yearning is a common one--for a better and different life. Dondup, delayed by the timeless pace of his village, is forced to hitchhike through the beautiful wild countryside of Bhutan to reach his goal. He shares the road with a monk, an apple seller, a papermaker and his beautiful young daughter, Sonam. Throughout the journey, the perceptive yet mischievous monk relates the story of Tashi. It is a mystical fable of lust, jealousy and murder, that holds up a mirror to the restless Dondup, and his blossoming attraction to the innocent Sonam. The cataclysmic conclusion of the monk's tale leaves Dondup with a dilemma--is the grass truly greener on the other side?—Sujit R. Varma

TITLE: Death Race 2050 (2017)
PLOT: Five long decades after Death Race 2000 (1975), in the overpopulated United Corporations of America, the annual Death Race is about to begin. This time, Frankenstein is up against no-nonsense challengers. How many points will he score?

TITLE: Wolf (1994)
PLOT: Publisher Will Randall becomes a demon wolf and has to fight to keep his job.

response.list_A_description: List A shows significant diversity, ranging from animated movies (The Boss Baby) to historical dramas (The Diary of Anne Frank) and international films (Aferim!).  There's little overlap with the preferred movies; the only potential connection is the family-friendly aspect of The Boss Baby, which is a distant relation to the preferred movies' themes.
response.list_B_description: List B presents a mix of genres, including drama (Bronx Tale), thriller (The Dead Center), and comedy (Recep Ivedik 3).  The preferred movies' action and adventure elements are somewhat reflected in some of the titles, but the overall thematic coherence is weak.
response.list_C_description: List C is a diverse collection of movies with varying genres and tones.  There are some comedic elements (Michael Bolton's Big, Sexy Valentine's Day Special), documentaries (Saving Capitalism), and dramatic films (The Wedding Plan).  The connection to the preferred movies is minimal, with no clear thematic links.
response.list_D_description: List D offers a blend of war films (Hacksaw Ridge), animated movies (Where the Wild Things Are), and romantic dramas (The Notebook).  The action-adventure aspect of some preferred movies finds a slight echo in Hacksaw Ridge and Pirates of the Caribbean, but the overall thematic consistency is low.
response.list_E_description: List E features a mix of action (Bourne Identity), animation (Up, Inside Out), and drama (Gone Girl).  The action and superhero themes of several preferred movies are echoed here, making this list the most thematically similar to the preferred movies.
response.list_F_description: List F is a diverse collection of movies, including thrillers (The Usual Suspects), dramas (Sully), and animated films (The Hunchback of Notre Dame).  There's a slight connection to the preferred movies through the action-adventure elements in some titles, but the overall thematic coherence is weak.
response.preferred_movies_analysis: The preferred movies exhibit a preference for action, adventure, fantasy, and family-friendly themes.  Superhero movies (Spider-Man, Iron Man, Avengers), fantasy adventures (Aladdin, Jumanji, Harry Potter), and animated family films (102 Dalmatians, Charlie and the Chocolate Factory, Incredibles) are prominent.  There's a mix of live-action and animation, but the common thread is entertainment value with a blend of action and humor.
response.serendipity_summarization: The movies across the lists were largely unexpected, with a wide range of genres and themes represented.  While some lists showed slight thematic connections to the preferred movies (mostly through action or adventure elements), the overall serendipity was high due to the unexpected nature of most selections.  The interest level varied across lists, with some offering more engaging premises than others.
